meanings.sent1: I tend to misorder my books on the shelf.
meanings.sent2: Please do not misorder the files in the cabinet.
meanings.sent3: It was quite a misorder when I put the shoes in the fridge.
meanings.sent4: Her thoughts misorder themselves when she's nervous.
meanings.sent5: The wind misorders the fallen leaves in a chaotic dance.

meanings.definition: A disorder or confusion in arrangement.
meanings.sent1: The misorder of the papers made it hard to find the right one.
meanings.sent2: The misorder in the schedule caused a lot of confusion.
meanings.sent3: The misorder of colors in the painting gave it a unique charm.
meanings.sent4: The misorder of events in the story created an unexpected twist.
meanings.sent5: The misorder of the alphabet blocks made learning fun for the toddler.
